description:
I'm seeing the following unit test failure:

======================================================================
ERROR: test_block_external_addresses_validate_output_for_invalid_input (nova.tests.api.ec2.test_admin.AdminControllerTestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/tests/api/ec2/test_admin.py", line 374, in test_block_external_addresses_validate_output_for_invalid_input
    result = self._ac.block_external_addresses(self._c, '12.10.10.256/24')
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/ec2/admin.py", line 353, in block_external_addresses
    if not utils.is_valid_cidr(cidr):
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py", line 1027, in is_valid_cidr
    netaddr.IPNetwork(address)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/netaddr/ip/__init__.py", line 919, in __init__
    implicit_prefix, flags)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/netaddr/ip/__init__.py", line 782, in parse_ip_network
    value = ip._value
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'ip' referenced before assignment
-------------------- >> begin captured logging << --------------------
2012-01-31 16:36:21,154 AUDIT nova.api.ec2.admin [req-382d1bcb-4765-4ba5-b52c-afa9f14ec668 None None] Blocking traffic to all projects incoming from 12.10.10.256/24
--------------------- >> end captured logging << ---------------------




I"m at commit 2757b81116d5d6c508a83616e1341e03115240f2

Root cause is in the netaddr library.  

The relevant upstream bug is https://github.com/drkjam/netaddr/issues/6

Nova bug 886266 is related to this   https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/886266
title: ec2 AdminController unit test fails

comments.content:
I'm seeing the following unit test failure:

======================================================================
ERROR: test_block_external_addresses_validate_output_for_invalid_input (nova.tests.api.ec2.test_admin.AdminControllerTestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/tests/api/ec2/test_admin.py", line 374, in test_block_external_addresses_validate_output_for_invalid_input
    result = self._ac.block_external_addresses(self._c, '12.10.10.256/24')
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/api/ec2/admin.py", line 353, in block_external_addresses
    if not utils.is_valid_cidr(cidr):
  File "/opt/stack/nova/nova/utils.py", line 1027, in is_valid_cidr
    netaddr.IPNetwork(address)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/netaddr/ip/__init__.py", line 919, in __init__
    implicit_prefix, flags)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/netaddr/ip/__init__.py", line 782, in parse_ip_network
    value = ip._value
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'ip' referenced before assignment
-------------------- >> begin captured logging << --------------------
2012-01-31 16:36:21,154 AUDIT nova.api.ec2.admin [req-382d1bcb-4765-4ba5-b52c-afa9f14ec668 None None] Blocking traffic to all projects incoming from 12.10.10.256/24
--------------------- >> end captured logging << ---------------------




I"m at commit 2757b81116d5d6c508a83616e1341e03115240f2

Root cause is in the netaddr library.  

The relevant upstream bug is https://github.com/drkjam/netaddr/issues/6

Nova bug 886266 is related to this   https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/886266
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikeyp-3

comments.content: We ended up just dropping that code: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/fced0f58bcbaef6fff76c6719e27e7d100aa721b
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon
